com.revature.rms.campus.services

Class BuildingServiceTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.rms.campus.services.BuildingServiceTest

  • @SpringBootTest
public class BuildingServiceTest
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BuildingServiceTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void findBuildingByIdWithValidId()
      findBuildingByIdWithValidId() ensures BuildingService.findById() returns the object containing the same id as the one provided.
      void findBuildingByTrainingLead()
      findBuildingByTrainingLead() returns an object containing the same trainer id as the one provided.
      void findBuildingByTrainingLeadIdNotPresent()
      findBuildingByTrainingLeadIdNotPresent() throws a ResourceNotFoundException when provided a trainer id that is a correct value but is not associated with any buildings.
      void findBuildingByTrainingLeadInvalidId()
      findBuildingByTrainingLeadInvalidId() throws an InvalidInputException when the provided id is less than or equal to zero.
      void findBuildingWithInvalidId()
      findBuildingWithInvalidId() throws an InvalidInputException when the provided id is less than or equal to zero or empty, that is the provided field is empty.
      void findBuildingWithValidIdNotFound()
      findBuildingWithValidIdNotFound() throws a ResourceNotFoundException when provided a correct id but, there is no building associated with it.
      void findBuildingWithValidName()
      findBuildingWithValidName() returns the object containing the same building name as the one provided.
      void findBuildingWithValidNameUsingAbbreviatedName()
      findBuildingWithValidNameUsingAbbreviatedName() returns the object containing the same abbreviated building name as the one provided.
      void testDeleteWithInvalidId()
      testDeleteWithInvalidId() ensures that buildingMongoRepository.deleteById() is not run when provided an invalid id.
      void testDeleteWithValidId()
      testDeleteWithValidId() ensures buildingService.delete() functions by verifying buildingMongoRepository.deleteById() is ran successfully one time when provided with a valid id.
      void testFindAll()
      testFindAll() ensures BuildingService().findAll() returns a list of all the existing Building objects.
      void testFindAllBuildingWithNoCampus()
      testFindAllBuildingWithNoCampus() returns an empty list rather than returning null, thus avoiding a potential NullPointerException in the future.
      void testSaveWithNullBuilding()
      testSaveWithNullBuilding() ensures BuildingService.save() will not work if a null building object is being saved.
      void testSaveWithValidBuilding()
      testSaveWithValidBuilding() ensures BuildingService.save() is functioning properly with the valid or correct input.
      void testUpdateWithValidBuilding()
      testUpdateWithValidBuilding() passes in a building object with changed fields to the buildingMongoRepository.save() to persist the changes and return the updated saved building object.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BuildingServiceTest

        public BuildingServiceTest()

    • Method Detail

      • testSaveWithValidBuilding

        public void testSaveWithValidBuilding()
        testSaveWithValidBuilding() ensures BuildingService.save() is functioning properly with the valid or correct input. A non-null building object should be returned.

      • testSaveWithNullBuilding

        public void testSaveWithNullBuilding()
        testSaveWithNullBuilding() ensures BuildingService.save() will not work if a null building object is being saved. If the building object is null, a ResourceNotFoundException will be thrown since the method does not meet the desired criteria for the method to execute properly.

      • testFindAll

        public void testFindAll()
        testFindAll() ensures BuildingService().findAll() returns a list of all the existing Building objects.

      • testFindAllBuildingWithNoCampus

        public void testFindAllBuildingWithNoCampus()
        testFindAllBuildingWithNoCampus() returns an empty list rather than returning null, thus avoiding a potential NullPointerException in the future.

      • findBuildingByIdWithValidId

        public void findBuildingByIdWithValidId()
        findBuildingByIdWithValidId() ensures BuildingService.findById() returns the object containing the same id as the one provided.

      • findBuildingWithValidIdNotFound

        public void findBuildingWithValidIdNotFound()
        findBuildingWithValidIdNotFound() throws a ResourceNotFoundException when provided a correct id but, there is no building associated with it.

      • findBuildingWithInvalidId

        public void findBuildingWithInvalidId()
        findBuildingWithInvalidId() throws an InvalidInputException when the provided id is less than or equal to zero or empty, that is the provided field is empty.

      • findBuildingWithValidName

        public void findBuildingWithValidName()
        findBuildingWithValidName() returns the object containing the same building name as the one provided.

      • findBuildingByTrainingLead

        public void findBuildingByTrainingLead()
        findBuildingByTrainingLead() returns an object containing the same trainer id as the one provided.

      • findBuildingByTrainingLeadInvalidId

        public void findBuildingByTrainingLeadInvalidId()
        findBuildingByTrainingLeadInvalidId() throws an InvalidInputException when the provided id is less than or equal to zero.

      • findBuildingByTrainingLeadIdNotPresent

        public void findBuildingByTrainingLeadIdNotPresent()
        findBuildingByTrainingLeadIdNotPresent() throws a ResourceNotFoundException when provided a trainer id that is a correct value but is not associated with any buildings.

      • findBuildingWithValidNameUsingAbbreviatedName

        public void findBuildingWithValidNameUsingAbbreviatedName()
        findBuildingWithValidNameUsingAbbreviatedName() returns the object containing the same abbreviated building name as the one provided.

      • testUpdateWithValidBuilding

        public void testUpdateWithValidBuilding()
        testUpdateWithValidBuilding() passes in a building object with changed fields to the buildingMongoRepository.save() to persist the changes and return the updated saved building object. There is no need for a null building check since the object already exists.

      • testDeleteWithValidId

        public void testDeleteWithValidId()
        testDeleteWithValidId() ensures buildingService.delete() functions by verifying buildingMongoRepository.deleteById() is ran successfully one time when provided with a valid id.

      • testDeleteWithInvalidId

        public void testDeleteWithInvalidId()
        testDeleteWithInvalidId() ensures that buildingMongoRepository.deleteById() is not run when provided an invalid id. Instead it throws an InvalidInputException.
